search_information.query_displayed: Cognitive Outcomes in Public and Private Schools. Coleman, James And Others Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Cognitive outcomes in public and private schools
organic_results.snippet: Three types of analysis are carried out in this paper and provide strong evidence that there is, in vocabulary and mathematics, higher achievement for comparable students in Catholic and other-private schools than in public; the results are less consistent in reading. The last portion of the analysis shows the elements of school policy that can account for these differences--account for them by showing that achievement is just as high in the public sector when the policies and the resulting student behavior are like those in the Catholic or …

publication_info.summary: J Coleman, T Hoffer, S Kilgore - Sociology of education, 1982 - JSTOR
